<h2 style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><a name="_Current_Announcements:"></a><span

<p class=MsoNormal><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif";color:red'><o:p> </o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpFirst style='margin-bottom:12.0pt;mso-add-space:
auto;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings;color:black'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='color:black'>The Final Exam answer
key has been posted below and is also available <a
href="../cs171-old-tests/2014-wq-cs171-old-tests/2014-wq-cs-171-final-exam-key.pdf">here</a>.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='margin-bottom:12.0pt;mso-add-space:
auto;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings;color:black'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='color:black'>The Quiz #4 answer key
has been posted below and is also available <a
href="../cs171-old-tests/2014-wq-cs171-old-tests/2014-wq-cs-171-quiz-4-key.pdf">here</a>.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='margin-bottom:12.0pt;mso-add-space:
auto;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings;color:black'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='color:black'>The tournament staff
will run several different independent final tournaments, each one with
different board sizes and win lengths.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 
</span>One will be with gravity 'off' and the rest with gravity 'on.'<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>As well, one will be a 3x3 board with
gravity 'off' and win length 3; i.e., classic Tic-Tac-Toe (this does not count
as the condition that will have gravity 'off'). Your final AI tournament score
(for Bonus Points) will be your aggregate AI score, as summed across all the
different tournament conditions they choose.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='margin-bottom:12.0pt;mso-add-space:
auto;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings;color:black'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='color:black'>The Project Report
Template has been moved out of “CS171ConnectKStudentResources” and
is now available in the Project section as both Word and PDF formats.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='margin-bottom:12.0pt;mso-add-space:
auto;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings;color:black'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='color:black'>Please fill out your
student course evaluations for CS-171. Student course evaluations are very
important to me for monitoring and improving the course content, and very
important to UCI for evaluating our success at our educational mission.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='margin-bottom:12.0pt;mso-add-space:
auto'><span style='color:black'><span style='mso-tab-count:1'>            </span>***<span
class=GramE>*<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Every</span> student
who fills out a course evaluation for CS-171 will receive a bonus of 1% added
to their final grade, free and clear, off the curve, simply a bonus. ****<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='margin-bottom:12.0pt;mso-add-space:
auto;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings;color:black'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='color:black'>On Tue., 11 Mar.,
following Quiz #4, we will have student talks by the top-scoring teams of Week
8. The six best teams will reveal what they did to succeed.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='margin-bottom:12.0pt;mso-add-space:

in this special case that day, I will insist that you show courtesy and respect

style='mso-tab-count:1'>            </span>Anyone
who leaves class that day before *ALL* student talks are finished will receive
an “F” (zero) on Quiz #4.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

style='color:black;background:yellow;mso-highlight:yellow'><span
style='mso-tab-count:1'>            </span>You
are *OBLIGED* to remain in class that day, courteous and respectful, while
*ALL* student talks are given.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='margin-bottom:12.0pt;mso-add-space:

style='mso-tab-count:1'>            </span>Please
bring your UCI ID to class that day, in case I need to census IDs at the end to
enforce this mandate.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='margin-bottom:12.0pt;mso-add-space:

Wingdings;color:black'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='color:black'>The Quiz #3 answer key
has been posted below and is also available <a
href="../cs171-old-tests/2014-wq-cs171-old-tests/2014-wq-cs-171-quiz-3-key.pdf">here</a>.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='margin-bottom:12.0pt;mso-add-space:
auto;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings;color:black'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='color:black'>The Mid-term Exam key
has been posted below, and is also available <a
href="../cs171-old-tests/2014-wq-cs171-old-tests/2014-wq-cs-171-midterm-exam-key-cancel-2.pdf">here</a>.
Your Mid-term Exams will be returned at the end of class Thursday, 20 Feb.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='margin-bottom:12.0pt;mso-add-space:
auto;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings;color:black'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='color:black'>Please make sure that
your AI has no memory leaks and does not consume excessive memory. We will test
for this condition prior to running your AI in the tournament.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='margin-bottom:12.0pt;mso-add-space:
auto;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings;color:black'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='color:black'>As announced in
lecture, the Reader will pass out Quiz #2 (and #1 if you did not pick it up
yet) at the end of class on Tue., 11 Feb., so that you can use them to study
for the Mid-term.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='margin-bottom:12.0pt;mso-add-space:
auto;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings;color:black'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='color:black'>As announced in
lecture, another extra-credit opportunity has been provided:<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>At the end of Week 8 we will run a
second “draft” tournament with your revised shells, and the top
~5-6 teams will be invited to give a 5-minute talk on Tue., 11 Mar., to discuss
their winning secrets. To qualify for extra credit, your team must give the
talk.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='margin-bottom:12.0pt;mso-add-space:
auto;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings;color:black'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='color:black'>A student has
recommended ‘quizlet.com’ as a good online study resource. While I
cannot vouch for it, apparently it contains several good study aids for your
textbook.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='margin-bottom:12.0pt;mso-add-space:
auto;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings;color:black'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='color:black'>The Quiz #2 answer key
has been posted below and is available <a
href="../cs171-old-tests/2014-wq-cs171-old-tests/2014-wq-cs-171-quiz-2-key.pdf">here</a>.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='margin-bottom:12.0pt;mso-add-space:
auto;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings;color:black'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='color:black'>The Project Section
below now has new coding shells and three example AIs that you or your AI can
play against: a good AI, an average AI, and a poor AI. The three example AIs
below will only work with the new shells.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='margin-bottom:12.0pt;mso-add-space:
auto;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings;color:black'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='color:black'>The </span>Reader,
Mohsen <span class=SpellE>Hejrati</span>, has updated his office hours to be
Monday 8-10am. This change is now reflected below.<span style='color:black'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='margin-bottom:12.0pt;mso-add-space:
auto;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span

Wingdings;color:black'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]>Quiz #1 will be distributed at the end of class
Thursday, 30 Jan.<span style='color:black'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='margin-bottom:12.0pt;mso-add-space:

Wingdings;color:black'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]>Revised project shells will appear shortly,
along with other material in support of your project.<span style='color:black'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='margin-bottom:12.0pt;mso-add-space:
auto;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings;color:black'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='color:black'>A slightly revised
version of the Project Specification has been issued. It now states that entry
into the tournament is automatic, not optional; and that gravity will be on in
the tournament, not off.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='margin-bottom:12.0pt;mso-add-space:
auto;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings;color:black'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]>**** CS-171: Form Project Teams now! **** <br>
(1) <span class=GramE>By</span> the end of week 4 (i.e., by Fri 31 Jan) you are
obliged to notify the Reader (<a href="mailto:shejrati@uci.edu">shejrati@uci.edu</a>)
about your team status: <br>
<span style='mso-tab-count:1'>            </span>(1.1)
What is your team name --- creativity is encouraged! <br>
<span style='mso-tab-count:1'>            </span>(1.2)
<span class=GramE>Who</span> is your partner?  <span class=GramE>or</span>
are you a solo team? <br>
<span style='mso-tab-count:1'>            </span>There
is an EEE CS-171 Message Board "Seeking project programming team
partner" intended for use by students seeking a project partner. <br>
(2) By the end of week 7 (i.e., by Fri 21 Feb) you are obliged to deposit a
"draft" version of your AI in the EEE <span class=SpellE>DropBox</span>. 
We will run a "draft" tournament and report the results. Your EEE <span
class=SpellE>DropBox</span> submission must be a single “zipped”
file named “<span class=SpellE>yourID_yourTeamName</span>.”<br>
(3) By the end of week 10 (i.e., by midnight Fri 14 March) you are obliged to
deposit a "final" version of your AI in the EEE <span class=SpellE>DropBox</span>. 
We will run a "final" tournament and report the results.  You
will receive Bonus Points depending on how well your AI did in the tournament,
as discussed in lecture. <br>
(4) PLEASE NOTE:  All teams will participate in the tournament. 
Although the Specification says that tournament participation is optional, that
statement is in error and will be corrected shortly.  All teams will
participate in the tournament.<span style='color:black'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

normal'>:</b><span style='color:black'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

class=GramE><span style='color:black'>Women in Information and Computer
Sciences (WICS) is</span></span><span style='color:black'> excited to present: <br>
Week 4 Event: First Android App Development Meeting <br>
Interested in learning how to make an Android App? WICS is holding a <br>
5-week Android App tutorial session starting Week 4 of Winter Quarter. <br>
WICS Project Meetings will begin on Thursday, January 30th at 7:00 pm <br>
(this is also the last opportunity to join). Location will be at DBH 5011. <br>
<span class=GramE>Stay updated with our website <br>
(<a href="http://wics.ics.uci.edu/project-development/">http://wics.ics.uci.edu/project-development/</a>)
and join</span> our Facebook group <br>
(<a href="https://www.facebook.com/groups/672842286101018/">https://www.facebook.com/groups/672842286101018/</a>)
to get more <br>
information! <br>
Also, don't forget to bring your laptops! <br>
Snacks will be provided during every meeting, we hope to see you there! <o:p></o:p></span></p>

</span></h2>

<h2><a name="_Goal:"></a><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:red'>Goal:</span><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";
color:black'>The goal of this class is to familiarize you with the basic
principles of artificial intelligence. You will l</span><span style='font-size:
12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>earn <span style='color:black'>some
</span>basic AI techniques, the problems for which they are applicable, and
their limitations.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>The
course content is organized roughly around what are often considered to be three
central pillars of AI: Search, Logic, and Learning. Topics covered include
basic search, heuristic search, game search, constraint satisfaction, knowledge
representation, logic and inference, probabilistic modeling, and machine
learning algorithms. <o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=center>

</div>

<h2><a name="_Class_Setup:"></a><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:red'>Class Setup:</span><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>The
course will be primarily lecture-based.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 
</span>There will be a Mid-term and a Final Exam.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>On every second Tuesday, the first 20
minutes will be an in-class pop quiz, followed by lecture.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>The frequent quizzes are intended to
encourage you to stay current with the course material.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>All exams and quizzes may cover all
material presented in class, including lectures and assigned textbook
reading.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Quizzes will cover mostly
material presented since the last quiz, and also may include questions that
many students missed on the previous quiz.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 
</span>The Final Exam will cover mostly material since the Mid-term Exam, and
also will include some questions intended to encourage you to remember the
earlier material.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>There
will be an AI coding project.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>You
are allowed to do the project by yourself, or you may form project teams of two
students following the “<a
href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pair_programming">Pair Programming</a>”
paradigm.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Please note that you are
encouraged to discuss concepts, methods, algorithms, etc.; but you are
forbidden to copy: (1) source code from any source, or (2) text from any source
unless properly cited and set off as a quote.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Except for class materials provided from
this class website, you must invent and write all of your own code by yourself
with your partner.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Except for
properly referenced material, you must write all of your project report by
yourself with your partner. Please note that your source code and project
report are subject to analysis by automated plagiarism detection programs, and
that direct copying will be treated as an act of academic dishonesty (please
see the section on “<a href="#_Academic_Honesty:">Academic Honesty</a>”
below).<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Homework
will be assigned, but is not graded. The reason is that prior student course
evaluations alerted me to the existence of student cheating by way of copying
the homework answers.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>I deplore
this degree of personal degradation in dishonest students, but I cannot control
it, and so I avoid the opportunity.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 
</span>I remain determined to create a fair and honest educational experience
for all students, as best I can.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";color:black'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=left>

</span></h2>

<h2><a name="_Textbook"></a><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:red'>Textbook</span><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";
color:red'>Required:</span><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";color:black'><span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 
</span>Russell & <span class=SpellE><span class=GramE>Norvig</span></span><span
class=GramE> :</span> Artificial Intelligence; A Modern Approach, 3<sup>rd</sup>
edition.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<p><span style='mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:black'>The
course is based on, and the UCI bookstore has, the 3<sup>rd</sup> edition. The
assigned textbook reading is required, and is fair game for quizzes and
exams.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span></span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:red'>You
place yourself at a distinct disadvantage if you do not have the textbook.</span></b><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>I expect that you have a personal copy
of the textbook, and quizzes and exams are written accordingly.</span></b><span
style='mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:black'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p><span style='mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:black'>Please
purchase or rent your own personal textbook for the quarter (and then resell it
back to the UCI Bookstore at the end if you don't want it for reference).</span>
<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='color:red'>Please do not
jeopardize your precious educational experience with the false economy of
trying to save a few dollars by not having a personal copy of the textbook.</span></b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p><span style='mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:black'>Also,
for your convenience, I have requested that a copy of the textbook be placed on
reserve in the UCI Science Library.</span><strong><span style='font-weight:
normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'> There is a two-hour check-out limit. </span></strong>However,
please understand that with high student enrollments, it is unrealistic to
expect that these thin reserves will always be available when you need
them.  <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='color:red'>Please
purchase or rent your own personal textbook.</span></b><strong><span
style='color:red;font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><o:p></o:p></span></strong></p>

<p><strong><span style='background:yellow;mso-highlight:yellow;font-weight:
normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>I do deplore the high cost of textbooks.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>You are likely to find the book cheaper
if you search online at EBay.com, Amazon.com, and related sites.<o:p></o:p></span></strong></p>

<h2><a name="_Grading:"></a><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:red'>Grading:</span><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Your
grade will be based on the bi-weekly </span><span style='font-size:12.0pt'>quizzes
(20%), a project (20%), a mid-term exam (25%), and a final exam (35%).</span><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Homework is assigned but ungraded.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin-left:.5in;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo4'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;
mso-bidi-font-family:Symbol;font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><span
style='mso-list:Ignore'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>       
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>Quizzes will be given the first 20 minutes of class on the
dates listed in the syllabus below.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 
</span>Your lowest quiz score will be discarded in computing your grade.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>It is not possible to make-up missed
quizzes, but one missed quiz may be discarded as your lowest quiz score.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin-left:.5in;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo4'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;
mso-bidi-font-family:Symbol;font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><span

</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>The mid-term exam will be given in class on Thursday,
February 13, and is closed-book, closed-notes.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>It is not possible to make-up a missed
mid-term exam.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

"Times New Roman"'>The final exam will be given on Friday, March 21, 10:30am -
12:30 p.m., and is closed-book, closed-notes.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>The final exam will cover all course
material from the entire quarter, but mostly the second half.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>It is not possible to make-up a missed
final exam.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:.5in;

and times for all final exams are set by the UCI Registrar (<a
href="http://www.reg.uci.edu/calendars/finals/schedule-201314.html">Final Exam
Schedule 2013-14</a>).<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin-left:.5in'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:

a note from your doctor on official letterhead) or deaths in the family (I
require a copy of the death certificate).<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 
</span>Also, I honor all requests made by the UCI Disability Services Center.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

content, which remains anonymous), provided that enough students fill out
evaluations so that anonymity is not compromised.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>I will add 1% free bonus to the final

<p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:

<p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast'>(1) A Java shell.<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:

<p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast'>(3) A tournament shell,
which will let you play different versions of your AI against themselves to
refine your evaluation function.<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast'>(4) Three example AIs,

<h2><a name="_Study_Guides_---"></a><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:
"Arial","sans-serif";color:red'>Study Guides --- Previous CS-171 Quizzes,
Mid-term, and Final exams:</span><span class=MsoHyperlink><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:windowtext;
font-weight:normal;text-decoration:none;text-underline:none'><o:p></o:p></span></span></h2>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>Previous
CS-171 Quizzes, Mid-term exams, and Final exams are available here as study
guides.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><o:p> </o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>As an
incentive to study this material, at least one question from a previous Quiz or
Exam will appear on every new Quiz or Exam. In particular, questions that many
students missed are likely to appear again. If you missed a question, please
study it carefully and learn from your mistake --- so that if it appears again,
you will understand it perfectly. <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><o:p> </o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>Also, a
student has recommended ‘quizlet.com’ as a good online study
resource. While I cannot vouch for it, apparently it contains several good
study aids for your textbook.</span><span class=MsoHyperlink><span
style='color:windowtext;text-decoration:none;text-underline:none'><o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

<h2><a name="_Academic_Honesty:"></a><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:
"Arial","sans-serif";color:red'>Academic Honesty: </span><span
class=MsoHyperlink><span style='color:windowtext;text-decoration:none;
text-underline:none'><o:p></o:p></span></span></h2>

<p class=MsoNormal><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>Academic dishonesty is unacceptable
and will not be tolerated at the University of California, Irvine. It is the
responsibility of each student to be familiar with UCI's current academic
honesty policies. Please take the time to read the current <a
href="http://www.senate.uci.edu/senateweb/default2.asp?active_page_id=754">UCI
Senate Academic Honesty Policies</a> and the <a
href="https://www.ics.uci.edu/ugrad/policies/index.php#academic_honesty">ICS
School Policy on Academic Honesty</a>.</span></b></p>

<p><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>The
policies in these documents will be adhered to scrupulously. Any student who
engages in cheating, forgery, dishonest conduct, plagiarism, or collusion in
dishonest activities, will receive an academic evaluation of ``F'' for the
entire course, with a letter of explanation to the student's permanent file.
The <a href="http://www.ics.uci.edu/grad/sao/index.php">ICS Student Affairs
Office</a> will be involved at every step of the process. Dr. Lathrop seeks to
create a level playing field for all students.</span></b></p>
